business.headline: Gold softens, silver drops: Why are they losing momentum after Monday's rally?Gold and silver paused their strong rally from Monday, opening lower on Tuesday amid profit booking and weaker global sentiment. The dip raises a key question: why have the metals lost momentum so quickly?

Will Nifty cross 29,000 by 2026? Here's what this global brokerage expectsDomestic flows remain steady, earnings have held up better than expected, and the broader macro backdrop has turned more predictable. Together, these have opened the door for fresh medium-term forecasts.

8th Pay Commission: Government clarifies on DA-basic pay merger plans. Details hereResponding to a written question in the Lok Sabha, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary stated that there is no proposal at present to combine any part of the existing DA with basic pay.

Meesho IPO to open soon: Will it turn into next stock market jackpot? Check GMPMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

The dark side of lending: Loan recovery harassment and its mental health impactLoan recovery harassment is real, widespread, and it is silently pushing many into anxiety, depression, and even suicide.

Explained: Why Bajaj Housing Finance shares fell 9% todayBajaj Housing Finance stock has now slipped almost 10% in the past 5 days, 13% in the past month, 22.83% in the last 6 months, 28.85% over the past year and 41.46% over the last five years.
Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; HDFC Bank down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 132.28 points to 85,509.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 31.90 points to 26,143.85 as of 9:26 am.
Who is Ramakrishnan Chander, LIC's new Managing Director He joined LIC in 1990 as an Assistant Administrative Officer and has steadily moved up the ranks over the decades.

Big December IPO lineup: Key details of Meesho, Aequs, Vidya Wires and 13 othersFour mainboard IPOs — Meesho, Wakefit Innovations, Aequs and Vidya Wires are scheduled to hit the market, while a long list of SME issues will follow through the month.

India's Foreign Direct Investment up 18% in April-September, US inflows doubleThe inflow from the US more than doubled to USD 6.62 billion during the period, according to the latest government data released on Monday.

Why most early retirement plans fail: Expert breaks down the real problemMost people chasing early retirement don't fail because they earn too little, they fail because they rely on assumptions that don't hold up in real life. An expert explains where FIRE plans usually go wrong.

Airbus hit by fresh A320 production flaw as global fleet undergoes fixes: ReportThe latest snag comes just as airlines worldwide, including Indian carriers, rush through emergency software upgrades ordered after regulators flagged a flight-control vulnerability linked to solar radiation.

Govt moves to retain high taxes on tobacco, pan masala with new excise, cess billsThe Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, proposes fresh excise duties on all tobacco products, while the Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, seeks a new cess on pan masala and other notified sin goods.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 64.77 points lower at 85,641.90, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 27.20 points down at 26,175.75. Broader market indices also weakened as volatility ticked up and investors booked profits following a record-setting rally last week.

Will RBI announce a 25 bps rate cut? What to expect from the upcoming MPC meetingWith inflation staying unusually low and the economy showing strong growth, expectations of a small rate cut have gathered pace.

Will, gift deed or trust: Which is the best way to pass on your wealth?Most families believe a will is enough, but the truth is more complicated. Knowing when to use a will, gift deed or trust can determine whether your wealth transfers smoothly or breaks down in disputes.

How lifestyle inflation, not low income, is hurting your savings? Explains expertMost people blame low income for their poor savings, but financial experts point to something else entirely, i.e., lifestyle inflation. Each upgrade, no matter how small, reduces the space for savings. Is this holding you back too?

Silver hits record high as gold shines. What's behind the latest bullion rally?The precious metals market is buzzing again as silver hits a fresh record high and gold continues its steady climb. What's fuelling this powerful bullion rally?

Cancer patients in India face health insurance crisis, finds new studyCancer patients are facing a health insurance crisis. A new study finds early detection rising but coverage thinning, leaving households to manage high bills, multiple claims and growing out-of-pocket expenses.

entertainment.headline: Masaba Gupta gets emotional as she shares painful impact of birth certificate leak During a recent event, Masaba Gupta recounted how the leak of her birth certificate, which revealed her father's identity, affected her and her mother Neena Gupta. She described the experience as cruel, reflecting on the challenges faced by women in the public eye.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali De makes first post after his wedding to Samantha Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's yogic wedding at the Isha Foundation drew attention online after Raj's ex-wife Shhyamali De shared a series of cryptic social media posts. Her messages, posted before and after the ceremony, sparked curiosity amid the couple's new beginning.

Mammootty says he prefers antagonist roles over romantic ones: No fun playing hero Malayalam actor Mammootty shared insights on why playing complex antagonists is more rewarding than traditional hero roles, as he promotes his latest film. He will be seen next in Kalamkaval, which is expected to release in theatres on December 5.

Rasika Dugal says she wouldn't have accepted Animal: I won't celebrate misogyny Actor Rasika Dugal states she refuses to participate in films that celebrate misogyny or push propaganda. In a recent media interaction, she said that if offered she wouldn't have accepted a film like Animal.

Farhan Akhtar confirms Priyanka, Alia, Katrina's Jee Lee Zaraa: We'll start soon Farhan Akhtar has confirmed that his upcoming film Jee Le Zaraa, starring Alia Bhatt, Priyanka Chopra, and Katrina Kaif, will proceed after resolving significant scheduling and casting challenges that delayed production for several years.

RGV revisits his thunder thighs remark for Sridevi, defends objectifying her Ram Gopal Varma's remarks about superstar Sridevi have resurfaced online. In a recent interview, the director talked about being criticised for admiring Sridevi's beauty.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 85: Chaos erupts as Thanuja flips, Bharani in danger As the Ticket to Finale battle is set to begin, old fights resurface, loyalties shift and contestants struggle for valid points in the nomination episode.

Taylor Swift shares goosebumps-worthy Eras Tour finale trailer, check release date Taylor Swift is set to release the official trailer and full concert film of her final Eras Tour show in Vancouver, along with a new docuseries, both premiering on Disney+.

Frankenstein made by humans for humans: Guillermo del Toro slams AI at Gotham Awards Director Guillermo del Toro criticised artificial intelligence while receiving his Gotham Awards Vanguard Tribute. He asserted that his gothic science-fiction was "willfully made by humans, for humans."

Nick Jonas calls Priyanka Chopra his dream girl on special anniversary post Nick Jonas marked his seventh wedding anniversary with Priyanka Chopra by sharing a heartfelt Instagram post calling her his "dream girl."

BB 19: Emotional Gaurav Khanna denies using wife's no-children choice for sympathy Bigg Boss 19 finalist Gaurav Khanna responded to speculation about his wife Akanksha Chamola's choice not to have children. He explained his personal stance and addressed comments made during a press conference inside the house.

I'm a workaholic: Madhuri Dixit reacts to ongoing Deepika's 8-hour work shift row Madhuri Dixit weighed in on the ongoing debate around work hours in Bollywood, calling herself a "workaholic" and supporting women choosing their own schedules. Her remarks come as Deepika Padukone defends her preference for 8-hour shifts amid industry scrutiny.

My only intention was…: Ranveer Singh apologises after row over Kantara mimicry Ranveer Singh issued an apology after facing criticism for mimicking a scene from Rishab Shetty's Kantara: Chapter 1 at IFFI, emphasising his respect for the film and clarifying that his act was intended as a tribute.

Girija Oak on sudden viral fame, AI deepfakes: Bizarre and scary Actor Girija Oak shares her experience of sudden internet virality and the impact of AI-modified deepfakes. In an exclusive conversation, she highlights the dangers of clickbait and digital misuse in today's social media age.

Was Samantha engaged to Raj Nidimoru in February? Fans spot huge ring in old post Actor Samantha and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru got married on December 1 at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre. Fans observed a prominent ring on her finger in photos months before her wedding to Raj Nidimoru, raising questions about whether the couple had been engaged since February.

Samantha-Raj's wedding: David Beckham, Alia, Trisha, celebs shower love, support Actor Samantha and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru married in a private ceremony at the Isha Yoga Centre in Coimbatore. The announcement post drew warm wishes from the fraternity, including Alia Bhatt, Priyanka Chopra, Athiya Shetty, among others.

BB 19: Media grills contestants, Gaurav loses cool over being called fox In the latest episode of Bigg Boss 19, a press conference took place in the house, bringing tough questions and emotional exchanges among the top six contestants.

Gotham Awards: Leonardo's One Battle After Another leads night. Full winners list Leonardo DiCaprio's One Battle After Another won Best Feature, while Jafar Panahi's It Was Just an Accident picked up three key awards, including Best Director at the Gotham Awards 2025.

Kalamkaval teaser: Superstar Mammootty looks menacing in crime thriller A new teaser for Kalamkaval has been unveiled, revealing Mammootty in an intense and enigmatic role, with the film set to release on December 5.

general news.headline: Sanchar Saathi app not mandatory, can delete, government clarifies amid backlashSanchar Saathi app: Jyotiraditya Scindia's clarification comes amid a massive uproar over Centre's directions to phone manufacturers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi app on all phones.

Muslims should give up Gyanvapi, Hindus must stop new demands: Ex-ASI top officialFormer Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) regional director KK Muhammed pointed out that Mathura and Gyanvapi are two other places, apart from Ram Janmabhoomi, that are "as important for the Hindu community as Mecca and Medina are for Muslims." He warned that pursuing additional claims would not resolve the issue and could lead to further conflict.

Elon Musk says major war, possibly nuclear, is coming within 5 or max 10 yearsTech billionaire Elon Musk has made an ominous prediction. He believes that the world could fall into a nuclear conflict as early as 2030. While Musk did not specify how the conflict could start, he has mentioned this possibility in the past.

Apple to resist India order to preload Sanchar Saathi app on iPhoneApple seems to be at loggerheads with the Indian government once again. And once again, it is standing firm on its philosophy of not allowing third-party or government apps on iPhones, at least at this point in time according to a report.

My only intention was…: Ranveer Singh apologises after row over Kantara mimicryRanveer Singh issued an apology after facing criticism for mimicking a scene from Rishab Shetty's Kantara: Chapter 1 at IFFI, emphasising his respect for the film and clarifying that his act was intended as a tribute.

Case against Rameshwaram Cafe owners for food aduleteration, fake extortion caseA Bengaluru flyer filed an FIR against Rameshwaram Cafe after finding a worm in his food at the airport and later being falsely accused of extortion. Police have now booked the cafe owners and a representative for food adulteration and fabricating a false case.

Australia's Glenn Maxwell pulls out of 2026 mini auction, hints at ending IPL careerAustralia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has confirmed that he will not enter the IPL 2026 mini-auction. The 37-year-old becomes the latest player to withdraw from next season, following Andre Russell and Faf du Plessis.

Nanded man killed by girlfriend's family seen dancing with her father in old videoOn November 27, Saksham Tate was first shot and then his head was bludgeoned with a large stone by his girlfriend Aanchal Mamilwad's father, Gajanan, along with her brothers Sahil and Himesh and several associates. She has demanded the death penalty for her parents and brothers.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali De makes first post after his wedding to SamanthaSamantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's yogic wedding at the Isha Foundation drew attention online after Raj's ex-wife Shhyamali De shared a series of cryptic social media posts. Her messages, posted before and after the ceremony, sparked curiosity amid the couple's new beginning.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

Live: Both houses of Parliament resume, Kiren Rijiju promises discussion on SIRParliament Winter Session Day 2 Live Updates: Tuesday marks the second day of the winter session of Parliament of India, where the government is expected to push forward key legislations and the Opposition is likely to continue pressing for discussions on several issues, including the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls. On Monday, when the session began, both houses saw protests by Opposition members seeking debates, with the Lok Sabha witnessing multiple adjournments, while the Opposition staged a walkout in Rajya Sabha. Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the Opposition to avoid "drama" in the House and focus on constructive engagement to ensure productive outcomes. Stay tuned to India Today for the latest updates from the Parliament.

Imran Khan's supporters protest in Islamabad, Rawalpindi amid ban on gatheringsThe protests, organised by Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party, are taking place outside the Adiala Jail in Rawalpindi, where the former Prime Minister has been held since August 2023, and the Islamabad High Court.

Toxic air is quietly fuelling anxiety, depression and memory problems, warns psychiatristToxic air isn't just harming your lungs, it's silently rewiring your mood, memory and focus. Doctors say the brain feels pollution much faster than the body does.

Navy to get INS Aridhaman, third Indian-made nuclear submarineThe Indian Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi announced on Tuesday that INS Aridhaman, India's third indigenously built nuclear-powered submarine, is set to be commissioned soon. It's in the final stages of its trial.

Nati chicken, idli and 'unity' show at Shivakumar-Siddaramaiah's breakfast 2.0Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah visited Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar's home for a breakfast meeting featuring idli, dosa, upma, nati chicken and coffee. The meet came amid leadership speculation. Both leaders reiterated there was no rift.

Haryana student's IIT Bombay mess video wins Internet's attentionThe video shot by an IIT student from Haryana has drawn attention for showing how IIT Bombay's mess introduces students to food traditions they may not have experienced before.

Samantha-Raj's wedding: David Beckham, Alia, Trisha, celebs shower love, supportActor Samantha and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru married in a private ceremony at the Isha Yoga Centre in Coimbatore. The announcement post drew warm wishes from the fraternity, including Alia Bhatt, Priyanka Chopra, Athiya Shetty, among others.

Sanchar Saathi new Pegasus spyware? Centre's order on app raises stormAs government mandates mandatory install of Sanchar Saathi app in all phones in India, many on social media are comparing it to the Pegasus spyware. Of course, that is hyperbole. But the government demand sure comes across rather blunt and in poor faith.

What is Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha, Samantha and Raj's sacred yogic wedding ritual?Samantha Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's Bhuta Shuddhi Vivaha explained -- a sacred yogic wedding ritual that purifies the five elements and invokes Devi's grace.

Who is Amar Subramanya? Indian-origin AI veteran joins Apple to boost AI effortsAmar Subramanya is an Indian-origin AI expert who has recently joined Apple as its new AI vice president. Subramanya is a graduate from Bangalore University and has worked for the likes of Google DeepMind and Microsoft.

The unsung Indian scientist who helped create chemotherapy and redefined cancer careYellapragada Subbarow, an Indian biochemist, developed the biochemical basis for chemotherapy. Despite his vital contributions, he faced discrimination and remains underrecognised in India today.

Government wants Sanchar Saathi mandatory in all phones. What does this app do?It is official. Hours after a news report surfaced about a secret memo to phone companies, the government has now confirmed that it wants Sanchar Saathi app installed on all phones in India. This is mandatory and the users will not be able to delete or disable the app. What is Sanchar Saathi? We explain.

Astronaut captures unique rings of rock in the middle of SaharaThis photograph, taken by an astronaut aboard the International Space Station on September 13, 2025, shows the massif casting long shadows across the desert.

Gesture of goodwill: Khaleda Zia's party thanks PM Modi for speedy recovery messageThe BNP expressed sincere gratitude to PM Narendra Modi for his message wishing Khaleda Zia's speedy recovery. She has been placed on ventilation and remains under the supervision of a medical team that includes specialists from abroad.

Prabhas shares Boman Irani's intense look from The Raja Saab on actor's birthdayBoman Irani is set to share screen space with Prabhas and Sanjay Dutt in director Maruti's The RajaSaab, as Prabhas shared a new poster featuring Boman while wishing him a happy birthday.

Viral video: Rishab Shetty signals 'no' to Ranveer Singh's Kantara mimicryA viral IFFI 2025 video shows Rishab Shetty expressing his disapproval as Ranveer Singh mimics his Kantara Daiva performance, sparking backlash.

sports.headline: Ravi Shastri accused of shielding Gautam Gambhir after comments on Test decline India vs South Africa: Ravi Shastri backed Gautam Gambhir's view on India's batters failing during their 0–2 Test series defeat in November. However, the former head coach added he would have taken responsibility for the losses instead of criticising players publicly.

Usman Khawaja ruled out of 2nd Ashes Test as questions on his future linger Ashes: Australia opener Usman Khawaja has been ruled out of the 2nd Test match of the series. The left-hander was unable to recover from back spasms he suffered in the opening Test match.

Unstoppable! Vaibhav Suryavanshi hits 3rd T20 century before turning 15 Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed 108 off 61 balls for Bihar against Maharashtra at Eden Gardens on Tuesday. Hitting seven sixes and as many boundaries, the opening batter notched up his maiden hundred in the domestic T20 tournament.

Pink-ball Ashes Test: England beef up batting, replace Mark Wood with Will Jacks England have decided to beef up their batting lineup for the pink-ball Test in Brisbane by bringing in Will Jacks to replace Mark Wood. The match begins on December 4 with Australia leading the series.

Gambhir backlash makes no sense, he is the best coach and human: Ex-KKR star Former KKR star Rahmanullah Gurbaz jumped to the defence of Gautam Gambhir after the Indian coach was heavily criticised for the loss to South Africa in the recent Test series.

Arjun Tendulkar continues red-hot form with ball after big IPL trade Arjun Tendulkar continued his impressive bowling for Goa in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. He took three wickets and smashed a quickfire 16 in their 7-wicket win against Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday in Kolkata.

Hockey India eyeing Marijne return to women's team as Harendra Singh resigns Hockey India have reportedly approached Sjoerd Marijne to become the new women's team head coach after Harendra Singh's exit from the role. Marijne could be set for a second stint with the team after initially joining them in 2017.

Australia's Glenn Maxwell pulls out of 2026 mini auction, hints at ending IPL career Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has confirmed that he will not enter the IPL 2026 mini-auction. The 37-year-old becomes the latest player to withdraw from next season, following Andre Russell and Faf du Plessis.

Neymar's last push for FIFA World Cup 2026: The prince goes all-out to save his legacy Neymar's fight for a place at the 2026 World Cup has become a race against time. Playing through injury, the 33-year-old is pushing his limits to keep both Santos and his Brazil dreams alive.

Watch: Virat Kohli touched as kids with roses welcome batting star in Raipur India vs South Africa, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli was greeted by a group of young fans holding roses outside the Indian team hotel in Raipur, a day after his match-winning hundred in Ranchi. Kohli's arrival generated excitement as the team prepared for the second ODI against South Africa.

What did Rohit Sharma say after Virat Kohli's Ranchi hundred? Arshdeep reveals Arshdeep Singh revealed what Rohit Sharma said after Virat Kohli's hundred in Ranchi against South Africa. Rohit's reaction from the dressing room had gone viral after the star batter got to the landmark.

Why was Nitish Reddy picked? R Ashwin slams India squad selection for SA seriesR Ashwin has slammed the Indian squad selection for the South Africa series, as he questioned why Nitish Kumar Reddy is unable to find a spot in the playing XI. Nitish wasn't part of the side that defeated South Africa in the Ranchi ODI.

Green headlines 1355-player IPL 2026 auction list, Maxwell opts out: ReportsCameron Green and Steve Smith headline a group of major international and Indian names registered for the IPL 2026 mini-auction, scheduled for December 16 in Abu Dhabi. However, Glenn Maxwell has decided to opt out of the upcoming auction.

Not the first tough spell, nor the last: Fowler and James trust Liverpool's revivalLiverpool legends Robbie Fowler and David James have urged calm despite the champions' difficult run. Both believe the club has enough resilience and quality to recover once key players return and stability returns to the squad.

In all the noise, are we not enjoying Virat Kohli's greatness enough?IND vs SA, 1st ODI: Drowned in debates, numbers and noise, we often forget the simple joy of watching a master at work. Virat Kohli's innings in Ranchi cut through the clutter, urging us to pause, breathe, and just enjoy greatness.

England have set plans to handle Travis Head if he opens in Brisbane: Brydon CarseEngland enter the Brisbane Test searching for answers after Travis Head's explosive century in Perth. Brydon Carse insists the visitors have clear plans ready if the Australian left-hander opens again in the second Ashes Test.

Why does Gambhir stick with Harshit Rana? Sandeep Sharma's explanation goes viralIND vs SA: Veteran pacer Sandeep Sharma's resurfaced clip has provided a rare insight into why India continue to invest in Harshit Rana. His Ranchi spell against South Africa only boosted the selectors' belief that he is a long-term fast-bowling project worth backing.

Rohit and Dravid built India as a white-ball powerhouse that keeps on giving: AshwinR Ashwin believes India's white-ball rise began long before the current regime. The aggressive template set by Rohit Sharma and Rahul Dravid, he says, is now powering a new generation under Gautam Gambhir.

Lamine Yamal is not trying to be Lionel Messi: My football is about funBarcelona talisman Lamine Yamal has said that he is not trying to mimic Lionel Messi. In a bold interview, Yamal explained that Messi knows very well that he is not attempting to copy the latter's legacy at Barcelona.

Ranchi airport cheers for Team India as the victorious team leaves city. VideoIND vs SA: The Ranchi airport cheered in unison for the Indian team as they left for Raipur for their second ODI of the series. The Indian team emerged victorious against South Africa in Sunday's game.

Sports minister set for special meeting with ISL, I-League clubs and stakeholdersWith Indian football stuck in a commercial and structural deadlock, the sports ministry has stepped in. Mansukh Mandaviya's meeting with ISL and I-League stakeholders on December 3 may shape the immediate future of domestic competitions.

After World Cup heroics, Railways hands promotion to injured star Pratika RawalInjured World Cup hero Pratika Rawal has been handed a promotion by her employer Indian Railways. She was promoted from the position of senior clerk to the officer rank.

Red Bull apologises for slanderous Kimi Antonelli comments in Qatar GPF1: Red Bull made a public apology to Mercedes' Kimi Antonelli for making slanderous remarks against the driver in the final moments of the Qatar GP. Max Verstappen's race engineer had alleged that Antonelli had willingly conceded a position to Lando Norris.

Hardik Pandya returns from injury to play domestic cricket for Baroda in SMATHardik Pandya's long injury layoff is set to end with his return for Baroda in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. His domestic comeback will determine how quickly he can slot back into India's T20I plans.

Did Virat Kohli avoid Gautam Gambhir after Ranchi ODI?IND vs SA: Is there a tension brewing between two of India's most senior players and Gautam Gambhir? Eagle-eyed fans have spotted Virat Kohli potentially snubbing Gambhir after the 1st ODI.

Shubman Gill begins rehab ahead of South Africa T20IsIND vs SA: Shubman Gill's return to action now hinges on his COE fitness clearance after a three-week injury layoff. India await the medical report with the South Africa T20Is approaching quickly.

Travis Head ready to open in Brisbane amid Usman Khawaja's fitness concernsTravis Head is ready to open again in the second Ashes Test in Brisbane if required. His comments come amid fitness concerns for Usman Khawaja for the pink-ball Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
